/>
X.ii.1.B.1.e
.
Protection in the Absence of a Monetary Award
The protective provisions of
38 U.S.C. 110
and
38 CFR 3.951 (b)
do not require a concurrent award of monetary benefits.
Example
:  Even though a beneficiary has elected not to receive compensation for an evaluation which has been in effect for more than 20 years, the evaluation is protected.
Reference
:  For more information on protection in the absence of a monetary award, see
Salgado v. Brown
, 4.Vet.App. 316 (1993).
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B - Protected Ratings
citation: Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section B
